definitions: To mark with a stake or stakes.
To support with a stake or stakes.
To risk (money or something else of value) on the outcome of an unpredictable event, such as a race or game.
To claim a right or ownership to something, often by marking it.
To kill (a vampire) by driving a stake through its heart.
examples: They will stake out the perimeter.
He decided to stake his claim on the land.
She staked all her savings on the horse race.
The gardener will stake the young tree.
Van Helsing prepared to stake the vampire.
